metadata.title: Ultimate Whale Watching - Alaska Sea Grant Radio Show
metadata.description: If you want to see whales, and I mean a lot of whales, one of the best places to be this summer is in Alaska's Glacier Bay National Park. Here, dozens of humpback whales arrive each summer to feast on schools of pollock, herring and other fish. As Doug Schneider reports in this week's Arctic Science Journeys Radio, one scientist has the enviable job of keeping track of the park's largest visitors.
metadata.notes:
Purpose: Janet Doherty has a life many people would envy. As a biological technician with the National Park Service, she spends her days in a small open boat in Alaska's Glacier Bay National Park. There she keeps watch on humpback whales as they swim, feed and sometimes leap into the air. With at least 60 whales identified in the park this summer, Doherty says the whale watching has been especially good.
